FuncDef:
The rmon event command configures a way to process an event: to record a log or send trap messages.
The undo rmon event cancels the configuration. The rmon event command configures a way to process an event: to record a log or send trap messages. The undo rmon event cancels the configuration. By default, no event is triggered. Therefore, no log is recorded, and no trap message is sent.
CLIs: rmon event <entry-number> [ description <string> ] { log | trap <object> | log-trap <object> | none } [ owner <owner-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the index number of an event MIB entry.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

Specifies an event description.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.
If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks (").

Indicates that events are processed by sending trap messages to the NMS with the specified community name or user name.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.

The event is processed by recording logs and sending trap messages to the NMS with the specified community name or user name.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.

Indicates events that do not trigger actions. If such an event occurs, the system will not handle it.
-

Specifies the creator of the event entry.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo: The RMON threshold alarm function triggers events. The rmon event command can be used to set a way to process the events, to record a log or send trap messages to the NMS.
